intro: Satureja amani, commonly known as Amani thyme, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are fragrant and contain essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja amani is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
